SEARCH
Package net.elena.murat.math

Class IntersectionInterval

java.lang.Object
net.elena.murat.math.IntersectionInterval
public class IntersectionInterval extends Object
Represents an interval where a ray is inside a shape. Contains both entry (in) and exit (out) intersection information. Used for CSG (Constructive Solid Geometry) operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • IntersectionInterval

      public IntersectionInterval(double tIn, double tOut, Intersection in, Intersection out)
      Constructs an interval with entry and exit data.
      Parameters:
      tIn - The parameter t where the ray enters the shape.
      tOut - The parameter t where the ray exits the shape.
      in - The Intersection at the entry point.
      out - The Intersection at the exit point.

    • IntersectionInterval

      public IntersectionInterval(Intersection in, Intersection out)
      Alternative constructor using Intersection objects directly.
      Parameters:
      in - The entry intersection.
      out - The exit intersection.

  • Method Details

    • point

      public static IntersectionInterval point(double t, Intersection hit)
      Creates a degenerate interval for non-solid shapes (e.g., planes).
      Parameters:
      t - The intersection parameter.
      hit - The intersection data (used for both in and out).
      Returns:
      A new IntersectionInterval with tIn = tOut.

    • getEntry

      public Intersection getEntry()
      Returns the entry intersection.
      Returns:
      The Intersection at the entry point.

    • getExit

      public Intersection getExit()
      Returns the exit intersection.
      Returns:
      The Intersection at the exit point.

    • getTSorted

      public List<Double> getTSorted()
      Returns the t values (tIn, tOut) in sorted order (ascending). Useful for CSG boundary analysis.
      Returns:
      Unmodifiable list of doubles in ascending order.

    • isPoint

      public boolean isPoint()
      Checks if this interval is degenerate (single point).
      Returns:
      true if tIn equals tOut.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if this interval is valid (tIn lesser igual than tOut).
      Returns:
      true if the interval is valid.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
